metadata.title: CVE-2025-21648 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: conntrack: clamp maximum hashtable size to INT_MAXUse INT_MAX as maximum size for the conntrack hashtable. Otherwise, itis possible to hit WARN_ON_ONCE in __kvmalloc_node_noprof() whenresizing hashtable because __GFP_NOWARN is unset. See:  0708a0afe291 ("mm: Consider __GFP_NOWARN flag for oversized kvmalloc()calls")Note: hashtable resize is only possible from init_netns.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
